details: Created a bundled changelog data file and modal so players can review product updates from the account bar.

summary: Polished the interface styling and accessibility
details: Resolved the outstanding CSS lint violations, refreshed button states, and tightened utility classes so the app ships with a clean, consistent look.

Refined the new account menu into a compact, file-menu inspired widget with role badges, uppercase player names, and a slim character/chronicle/location strip while keeping the changelog button separate.
Reorganized the component tree and moved drawer, modal, badge, and widget styles into colocated CSS modules, trimming the global stylesheet and making future tweaks safer.

summary: Polished the character sheet and chronicle wizard
details: Moved the Character Overview, player session chrome, and chronicle creation wizard styles into dedicated modules so those surfaces render with their intended layout again while keeping the global stylesheet lean.
Hardened the Lambda handlers so API Gateway requests without the HTTP v2 metadata stop crashing, which restores the listCharacters and listChronicles player flows.

summary: Gave player menu roles distinctive icons
details: Replaced the parenthetical role letters with emoji-based badges so admins, moderators, and free players can be identified at a glance in the account menu.

summary: Moved the character sheet button into the list
details: Removed the left-nav character toggle and added an icon button to the character list so the drawer opens from within the session manager itself.
Shifted the New Character action next to the character list header so it matches the New Chronicle placement and keeps related controls together.

summary: Synced the character picker with chronicles
details: You can now pick any character while idle to preview them in the player menu and drawer, then once a chronicle loads that pair stays pinned to the top, greys out the alternates, and the leading icon/name open the sheet.
